: An AI-powered smartphone assistant that uses machine learning to anticipate user needs and preferences. It can learn from user behavior, such as their daily routines, to provide personalized recommendations and automate tasks.

Vox: A voice-activated smartphone assistant that uses natural language processing to understand and respond to user queries. It can provide real-time information, such as weather updates, news updates, and traffic updates, as well as perform tasks such as sending messages and making phone calls.

Zephyr: A smartphone assistant that uses augmented reality to provide users with a more immersive experience. It can overlay digital information on the real world, such as product information or directions, and provide interactive experiences such as virtual try-ons.

Lumen: A smartphone assistant that uses biometric data, such as heart rate and sleep patterns, to provide personalized health and wellness recommendations. It can track user progress and provide feedback on areas such as nutrition, exercise, and stress management.

Echo: A smartphone assistant that uses machine learning to predict user needs and preferences based on their online behavior. It can provide personalized recommendations for products, services, and content based on user browsing and purchase history, as well as track user activity across different devices and platforms.
